titleStmt.title: James W. Kenney to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5518

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos E. Bramblett Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner would respectfully state that at the last May Term 1864 of the Scott Circuit Court a Judgment in the name of the Commonwealth was rendered against him for the sum of $100- as a fine for the non-attendance on said Court as a witness of J. H. Cannon for whom this petitioner was bail. Petitioner states that said Cannon was in attendance the day that the bail bond was forfeited but at the time the case was called in which he was the witness. he happened had on some other business a few moments before the calling for trial absented himself supposing he would return in time. but when he returned he found that the case was called & continued this bail forfeited and hence is without remedy unless from the clemency of your excellency. he asks a remission of all of said sum, of $100- so far as by law is allowed.-

The witness J H Cannon unites in the foregoing petition
J H Cannon
We unite in petitioning the remission of the five above named

J G. Morrison Pr Js C C
S. R. Betts
Saml Gosley
H C Gracey
F C McCalla
A Duvall

Scott Circuit Court
VS
J Kinney
